title: Brainstormer Trivia with Rick Tosh
description:
So, Trivia-Mongers,¬†you think you're smart? Here's your chance to prove it. Join Quizmaster, Rick Tosh for "Brainstormer Trivia". Six rounds of compelling trivia that boggles the mind and stirs the soul! An entertaining evening of fun, and ephemera in a friendly team trivia competition. Pit your wits against friends and other intelligent life. Show off your astounding knowledge of pop culture, movies, music, sports, science, literature, famous faces, and more. Order delicious food and drinks while you play! Win HopMonk Gift Cards, fabulous prizes and bragging rights. Prizes for 1st, 2nd, and Average Team Score...It's FREE to play! title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

Date & Time: Mondays @ 7PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

description:
Discover your family story at our Family Search Center You will find our center in the Lakeport building in the room next to the nursery. Local volunteers can help jumpstart your family history journey. Our center is staffed on Tuesdays from 1pm - 4pm, reach us in person or by phone \(707\) 280-9545 during those hours. All services provided in centers are free. You‚Äôll enjoy: Personalized help Center guests can receive personal help from volunteers in one of more than 5,400 centers worldwide. Access to technology Centers offer complimentary access to computers, internet, and subscription family history websites. Available resources vary by location. Access to exclusive records Visitors to FamilySearch Centers get special access to images of historical records that are only available in centers. Websites available at all locations: Ancestry, My Heritage, Family Search, Find My Past, American Ancestors, Geneanet https://www.family search.org Explore videos about family history and temples at collection/temple-and-family-history-messages-from-leaders?lang=eng

title: After School - Create Your Own Storybook World!
description:
Every Tuesday 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM

Please see website: Exact dates are available on Enrichment.kids. Click the registration links below.

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Kids

Age\(s\)

7-11

$100 ‚Äì Monthly Session Cost

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you‚Äôll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist: ¬†Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\),¬†Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\)¬†. Inspired by their playful styles, students will¬†design and develop their very own characters‚Äîdeciding where these characters¬†live, work, play, eat, and sleep!¬†Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.¬† Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

¬†watercolor, paint, pens,¬†and¬†collage

¬†recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use¬†watercolor techniques¬†to add color and mood

How¬†scale¬†helps characters and environments feel real

The¬†arc of a story‚Äîbeginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using¬†background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Room 116

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Bachata with ALEX
description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Russian River Zine Club
description:
The Russian River Zine Club is a collaborative space to create and share zines in community every third Wednesday of the Month \(from 6-7:30pm\). Each month there will be a mini-demonstration of a binding, illustration, or crafting technique, along with time to work on your own projects and to share your favorite zines with the group. The library will provide basic supplies like paper, glue sticks, scissors, etc., but you should feel free to bring your own materials and tools. You can also bring zines that you are excited about to share out with others. Snacks will be provided but you are also welcome to bring your own.

Hosting the night is KJ Danny D (Danny Duclos)‚Äîone of the most popular and in-demand karaoke hosts around. We‚Äôre genuinely stoked to have him bringing his style, energy, and crowd-moving presence to Downtown Santa Rosa.

This isn‚Äôt sleepy bar karaoke. Danny brings a fresh, high-energy approach that turns singing into a full-on late-night experience. Big stage, great sound, packed room, and the kind of momentum that keeps people singing well past closing time.

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Paul Anka: A Man and His Music
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Back to All Shows

Paul Anka: A Man and His Music

Thursday, May 21, 2026

7:00 pm

BUY TICKETS 

With his craftsmanship as a master songwriter and his youthful tenor sound, Paul Anka has been crooning his way to fans‚Äô hearts with a polished blend of classic pop and rock-and-roll energy. 

His duets albums, Body of Work in 1998 that features Frank Sinatra, Celine Dion, Tom Jones and daughter Anthea Anka, and Duets in 2013 with Frank Sinatra, Michael Jackson, Tom Jones, Celine Dion, and Michael Bubl√©, celebrate his lifelong collaborations with a variety of artists. Duets set a milestone in Billboard Chart history because, with the CD, Anka became the only artist to have a CD on the Billboard Top 100 Chart for seven consecutive decades. 

At 81 years old, Paul Anka continues to write and record. His latest two albums, Making Memories and Sessions, were released in 2021 and 2022 respectively. The albums featured new and never-before recorded songs as well as new takes on old classics, notably ‚ÄúPut Your Head On My Shoulder,‚Äù with Olivia Newton John, one of her last recorded songs, and ‚ÄúMy Way,‚Äù featuring Michael Buble and Andrea Bocelli. 

 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS

Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: The Lifespan of a Fact
description:
**Truth or Spin? The Fight over Facts.**

***‚ÄúDesigned for laughs, but the play has a provocative undercurrent regarding issues that make it a compelling piece of theatre.‚Äù* ‚ÄîCincinnati CityBeat**

***The Lifespan of a Fact* is a critically acclaimed Broadway play that delves into the contentious realm where truth and storytelling intersect. The narrative centers on Emily Penrose, the exacting editor-in-chief of a prestigious magazine, who assigns Jim Fingal, an ambitious young fact-checker, to verify a groundbreaking essay by renowned author John D‚ÄôAgata. As Jim meticulously scrutinizes the piece, he discovers numerous embellishments, igniting a fierce debate over the boundaries of factual accuracy versus creative license. This fast-paced, blistering comedy offers a timely exploration of the high-stakes world of publishing, where the quest for truth becomes a battleground of wit, ethics, and editorial judgment.**

**The play has been lauded for its sharp dialogue and thought-provoking themes, prompting audiences to question: In storytelling, how far can one go before the facts become fiction?**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: 85 mins, no intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185

Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?

Are you a salsa dancer who has the basics down but is ready to add more? Our Intermediate Salsa Class with Tyler is designed to help you transform your dancing moves. You‚Äôll learn intermediate dancing techniques that will help you:

Express yourself with sharper footwork and styling.

title: The Lifespan of a Fact
description:
**Truth or Spin? The Fight over Facts.**

***‚ÄúDesigned for laughs, but the play has a provocative undercurrent regarding issues that make it a compelling piece of theatre.‚Äù* ‚ÄîCincinnati CityBeat**

***The Lifespan of a Fact* is a critically acclaimed Broadway play that delves into the contentious realm where truth and storytelling intersect. The narrative centers on Emily Penrose, the exacting editor-in-chief of a prestigious magazine, who assigns Jim Fingal, an ambitious young fact-checker, to verify a groundbreaking essay by renowned author John D‚ÄôAgata. As Jim meticulously scrutinizes the piece, he discovers numerous embellishments, igniting a fierce debate over the boundaries of factual accuracy versus creative license. This fast-paced, blistering comedy offers a timely exploration of the high-stakes world of publishing, where the quest for truth becomes a battleground of wit, ethics, and editorial judgment.**

**The play has been lauded for its sharp dialogue and thought-provoking themes, prompting audiences to question: In storytelling, how far can one go before the facts become fiction?**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: 85 mins, no intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185

**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Basic directional steps:¬†You‚Äôll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work:¬†Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns:¬†We‚Äôll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We‚Äôve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

**The play has been lauded for its sharp dialogue and thought-provoking themes, prompting audiences to question: In storytelling, how far can one go before the facts become fiction?**

title: The Lifespan of a Fact
description:
**Truth or Spin? The Fight over Facts.**

***‚ÄúDesigned for laughs, but the play has a provocative undercurrent regarding issues that make it a compelling piece of theatre.‚Äù* ‚ÄîCincinnati CityBeat**

***The Lifespan of a Fact* is a critically acclaimed Broadway play that delves into the contentious realm where truth and storytelling intersect. The narrative centers on Emily Penrose, the exacting editor-in-chief of a prestigious magazine, who assigns Jim Fingal, an ambitious young fact-checker, to verify a groundbreaking essay by renowned author John D‚ÄôAgata. As Jim meticulously scrutinizes the piece, he discovers numerous embellishments, igniting a fierce debate over the boundaries of factual accuracy versus creative license. This fast-paced, blistering comedy offers a timely exploration of the high-stakes world of publishing, where the quest for truth becomes a battleground of wit, ethics, and editorial judgment.**

**The play has been lauded for its sharp dialogue and thought-provoking themes, prompting audiences to question: In storytelling, how far can one go before the facts become fiction?**

title: In A Landscape - Classical Music with Hunter Noack in the Wild
description:
Founded in 2016 by classical pianist Hunter Noack, IN A LANDSCAPE: Classical Music in the Wild is a 501\(c\)\(3\) nonprofit outdoor concert series where America's most stunning landscapes replace the traditional concert hall. A 9-foot Steinway grand piano travels on a flatbed trailer to State and National Parks, urban greenspaces, working ranches, farms, and historical sites for classical music concerts that connect people with each landscape. To meet the acoustical challenges of performing in the wild, music is transmitted to concert-goers via wireless headphones. No longer confined to seats, audiences explore the landscape, wander through secret glens, lie in sunny meadows, and roam old growth forests. IN A LANDSCAPE has presented 275 concerts in Oregon, Washington, Montana, Idaho, New York, Utah, Wyoming, and California to over 55,000 people. Folks travel from near and far. Local ranchers, loggers, and farmers gather with visiting city dwellers and tourists from beyond.

title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

title: After School - Create Your Own Storybook World!
description:
Every Tuesday 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM

Please see website: Exact dates are available on Enrichment.kids. Click the registration links below.

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Kids

Age\(s\)

7-11

$100 ‚Äì Monthly Session Cost

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you‚Äôll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist: ¬†Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\),¬†Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\)¬†. Inspired by their playful styles, students will¬†design and develop their very own characters‚Äîdeciding where these characters¬†live, work, play, eat, and sleep!¬†Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.¬† Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

¬†watercolor, paint, pens,¬†and¬†collage

¬†recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use¬†watercolor techniques¬†to add color and mood

How¬†scale¬†helps characters and environments feel real

The¬†arc of a story‚Äîbeginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using¬†background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

title: Napoleon Dynamite Live A Conversation with Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez, and Jon Gries
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Since the release of the beloved indie classic, Napoleon Dynamite, 20 years ago, much has changed, but the characters, as enduring as they are endearing, stay in our hearts. This unique evening includes a full screening of Napoleon Dynamite, followed by a lively discussion with cast members, Jon Heder \(Napoleon Dynamite\), Jon Gries \(Uncle Rico\), and Efren Ramirez \(Pedro\). Perfect for the whole family, this live show is a wild and hysterical blend of Q&A, comedy improv, game show, and party, with plenty of audience participation.

VIP Meet and Greet Add-On Option:

Elevate your event experience with this exclusive chance to meet Jon Heder \(Napoleon\), Efren Ramirez \(Pedro\), and Jon Gries \(Uncle Rico\), including a photo opportunity. With limited tickets available, be sure to reserve yours soon!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Bachata with ALEX
description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: Spooky Book Club
description:
Spooky Book Club meets at 6pm on the last Wednesday of each month. Read any novel, novella, graphic novel, etc. that fits the monthly theme and join us for great conversation and community.

THEMES

January

Monsters & Creatures:¬†Vampires, werewolves, demons, cryptids, or anything non-human and terrifying. 

February

Folk Horror & Urban Legends:¬†Curses, rituals, superstition, isolated communities, local myths.

March

Survivor‚Äôs Guilt:¬†Survivors, slashers, killer-on-the-loose stories.

April

Psychological Terror:¬†Unreliable narrators, paranoia, mind games, and slow-burn dread.

May

Haunted Places:¬†Ghosts, cursed houses, abandoned buildings, restless spirits.

June

Weird Fiction & Cosmic Horror:¬†Eldritch vibes, the unknowable, reality-bending strangeness

July

Body Horror:¬†Transformation, disease, medical terror, the uncanny in flesh.

August

Dark Academia:¬†Creepy campuses, secret societies, intellectual obsession.

September

Eco-Horror & Nature Strikes Back:¬†Creatures, plants, or environmental forces turning hostile.

October

Supernatural Thrillers:¬†Possessions, exorcisms, occult forces, or mysterious powers.

November

International Horror:¬†Any horror written by or set in another country/culture.

December

Gothic Classics & Modern Gothics:¬†Old mansions, family secrets, brooding atmosphere, gothic romance elements.

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: 2nd Annual Voces y Pasos: A Cultural Celebration
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Celebrate the rich cultural traditions of Mexico through the vibrant artistry of the musicians and dancers in LBC‚Äôs afterschool Marichi and Ballet Folkl√≥rico programs at¬†Voces y Pasos \(Voices and Steps\): A Cultural Celebration. Featuring more than 150 of Sonoma County‚Äôs talented youth,¬†Voces y Pasos¬†brings these traditions and celebrations to life in an unforgettable stage performance that pays tribute to their Mexican heritage.

LBC‚Äôs Mariachi Ensemble and its sister program, LBC‚Äôs Ballet Folkl√≥rico, enroll students from all over the county. Together they deliver stunning performances that blend technical skill, stage presence, and heartfelt expression while embodying the grace and vibrancy of traditional Mexican folk music and dance.

The young performers in these programs devote themselves to weekly rehearsals and regular performances at community events that continue to shape them into impressive artists. Thanks to the generosity of our donors and sponsors, they can participate at no cost to their families, with all equipment and costumes provided. Join us for an inspiring evening that shines the spotlight on the voices and steps of these talented students and honors the enduring power of culture, tradition, and community.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Date & Time:¬†Thursdays @7:30PM ‚Äì 8:30PM

Address:¬†4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

title: Aging with Grace: A Yoga Retreat for Adults 50 plus
description:
Aging with Grace: A Yoga Retreat for Adults 50 plus - Step into a joyful weekend of movement, relaxation, and renewal, thoughtfully designed for adults 50 and anyone who like this idea!

Book now and get $100.00 off listed prices. Offer valid until Feb 27, 2026

https://yourhealthandjoy.com/retreatmay2026/

$895.00 ‚Äì For 1 Guest in a Private Room \(Shared Cottage\)

We welcome back Guest Teacher Patricia Becker, beloved for her uplifting yoga and wellness teachings, to host a retreat that will rejuvenate your body, calm your mind, and rekindle your natural vitality.

This retreat tends tends to fill quickly‚Äîsecure your spot today!

Step into a joyful weekend of movement, relaxation, and renewal, thoughtfully designed for adults 50 and better.

As the seasons shift and nature begins to blossom, this retreat invites you to do the same‚Äîreconnect with your strength, flexibility, and inner glow.

With a nourishing blend of yoga, breathwork, meditation, and meaningful connection, you‚Äôll explore ways to move with greater ease, feel content, and age with grace. Whether you‚Äôre seeking more energy, deeper calm, or simply a pause from routine, this weekend offers the space to replenish, reset, and return home to yourself.

You‚Äôll stretch, strengthen, and smile your way through sessions supporting joint health, posture, spinal alignment, hip mobility, deeper breathing, and overall vitality‚Äîno pretzel poses required!

Playful curiosity and gentle guidance will help you tap into your body‚Äôs wisdom and celebrate what‚Äôs possible at every age.

What to Expect:

Uplifting yoga to build strength, balance, and mobility

Breathwork and meditation to calm your mind and restore energy

Time in nature to reflect, rest, and restore

Delicious vegetarian meals lovingly prepared

Connection with like-hearted people in a warm and welcoming space

Plenty of time to laugh, lounge, and be fully yourself

Hear what Guests have to say!

‚ÄúI loved the invigorating Aging With Grace Retreat at beautiful Ratna Ling ‚Äî which I attended with a few fellow Yoginis. I‚Äôm planning to return for more of Patricia‚Äôs gentle but powerful yoga, uplifting commentary, and lovely yoga community.‚Äù ‚Äî Desiree Petray

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a senior but I wanted gentle yoga and a relaxing weekend with time for introspection. I learned so much about my body and breath, and met amazing new friends. Patricia is knowledgeable, kind, and made the experience fun.‚Äù ‚Äî Ruby Williams

‚ÄúMy sister and I adored Patricia‚Äôs yoga retreat. The minute you arrive you know it will be special. Patricia creates a sense of community and offers just the right amount of stretching and strengthening. You feel graceful‚Äîlike you‚Äôve been enveloped by unconditional love.‚Äù ‚Äî Ann Protter

Retreat Schedule \(subject to change\):

\* Friday ‚Äì Arrive¬†

3:00 PM ‚Äì Check-in and Settle in¬†

4:30‚Äì5:30 PM ‚Äì Root & Release: Yoga for Your Feet & Ankles Gently land at Ratna Ling and reconnect with your foundation through soothing stretches and grounding breath.¬†

5:30‚Äì6:15 PM ‚Äì Dinner¬†

6:45‚Äì8:00 PM ‚Äì Opening Circle & Centering Practice Meet your fellow retreat guests and ease into retreat mode with light movement, intention-setting, and calming breathwork.

\* Saturday ‚Äì Stretch, Strengthen & Soften¬†

8:00‚Äì8:45 AM ‚Äì Breakfast¬†

9:00‚Äì10:00 AM ‚Äì Release & Realign: Yoga for Neck & Shoulders Let go of upper-body tension and invite ease and openness.¬†

11:15 AM‚Äì12:15 PM ‚Äì Lengthen & Decompress: Yoga for a Healthy Back Support your spine with mindful movement to restore strength and flexibility.¬†

12:15‚Äì1:00 PM ‚Äì Lunch¬†

1:00‚Äì4:30 PM ‚Äì Personal Time Walk, journal, nap, read, or enjoy a bodywork session.¬†

title: Sister Act
description:
**A Disco Diva, a Choir in Crisis, and a Whole Lot of Soul!**

***‚ÄúOne of the season‚Äôs happiest surprises.‚Äù* ‚ÄîElisabeth Vincentelli for New York Post**

***Sister Act* is the high-energy musical comedy based on the beloved 1992 film. Featuring an electrifying Alan Menken score infused with disco and gospel beats, this feel-good show is a celebration of music, sisterhood, and second chances.**

**When disco diva Deloris Van Cartier witnesses a crime, she‚Äôs forced into hiding‚Äîin a convent! Disguised as a nun, she transforms the struggling choir with her powerhouse voice, helping them find their sound while discovering her own. Nominated for five Tony Awards, *Sister Act* is a joyful, soul-stirring spectacle that proves music‚Äîand a little mischief‚Äîcan work miracles!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 30 mins including intermission

Book now and get $100.00 off listed prices. Offer valid until Feb 27, 2026

We welcome back Guest Teacher Patricia Becker, beloved for her uplifting yoga and wellness teachings, to host a retreat that will rejuvenate your body, calm your mind, and rekindle your natural vitality.

This retreat tends tends to fill quickly‚Äîsecure your spot today!

Step into a joyful weekend of movement, relaxation, and renewal, thoughtfully designed for adults 50 and better.

As the seasons shift and nature begins to blossom, this retreat invites you to do the same‚Äîreconnect with your strength, flexibility, and inner glow.

With a nourishing blend of yoga, breathwork, meditation, and meaningful connection, you‚Äôll explore ways to move with greater ease, feel content, and age with grace. Whether you‚Äôre seeking more energy, deeper calm, or simply a pause from routine, this weekend offers the space to replenish, reset, and return home to yourself.

You‚Äôll stretch, strengthen, and smile your way through sessions supporting joint health, posture, spinal alignment, hip mobility, deeper breathing, and overall vitality‚Äîno pretzel poses required!

Playful curiosity and gentle guidance will help you tap into your body‚Äôs wisdom and celebrate what‚Äôs possible at every age.

What to Expect:

Uplifting yoga to build strength, balance, and mobility

Breathwork and meditation to calm your mind and restore energy

Time in nature to reflect, rest, and restore

Delicious vegetarian meals lovingly prepared

Connection with like-hearted people in a warm and welcoming space

This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That‚Äôs why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps:¬†You‚Äôll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work:¬†Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns:¬†We‚Äôll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We‚Äôve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required:¬†Whether you‚Äôve never danced before or it‚Äôs been a while, you‚Äôre welcome here!

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles:¬†This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: A Year to Live
location:
Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
with Vinny Ferraro, Frank Ostaseski and Pam Dunn

This yearlong journey, inspired by Stephen Levine‚Äôs¬†*A Year to Live*, is a heartfelt invitation to people of all ages, at any stage of life. Together, in the spirit of community, we will explore how contemplating death can profoundly deepen our experience of living.

In our modern world, where we often shy away from the reality of our mortality, we rarely pause to consider the preciousness of each moment. The Buddha encouraged us to reflect on death not out of fear, but as a way to awaken to the fleeting beauty of our lives. By embracing this practice, we come to appreciate the fragility and impermanence of our existence.

This program is a yearlong exploration of forgiveness, gratitude, and letting go. Through guided meditations, thoughtful inquiry, and intimate group discussions, we will support one another in discovering what death has to teach us about life and vice versa.

**Program Includes**

**Format**: Online via Zoom (must know how to join a specific breakout room manually)

**Teachings**: Monthly (12) large group sessions (attendance at 10 of 12 live sessions required; this must include the first session on Jan 31st)

**Home Groups (required!)**: Monthly (12), 1-hour, self-facilitated, self-hosted Home Groups that meet in between large group sessions. They are a foundational aspect of this program and will be organized by Spirit Rock. Each group will determine a time/day and location (online or in-person) that works for everyone during the January large group session.

**Home practice**: Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: World Music & Dance Festival
description:
Carlitos Medrano will return with his popular Cuban & Latin Rhythms Drumming Workshop  Watch for more workshops and performances to be announced soon! Occidental World Music & Dance Festival  Celebrate the rhythms, cultures, and global creativity that make our community shine at the Occidental World Music & Dance Festival! This joyful, immersive event brings together extraordinary musicians and dancers from around the world for a day filled with exhilarating performances, interactive workshops, and irresistible beats. From captivating traditional artistry to innovative contemporary fusion, the festival invites audiences of all ages to experience the beauty of global cultures up close. With food, vendors, community activities, and plenty of space to dance, it's a feast for the senses and a celebration of unity through music and movement. Come be part of one of Occidental's most beloved and uplifting traditions! Ticket prices - adults Early bird pricing $55 through 12/31/25 $65 through April 30 $75 through May 29 $80 at the door Kids 12 and under free Teens half price Discounts for OCA members Workshops and performers will be announced soon. Get your tickets early and save!  Click here to read about last year's festival.  Get tickets

title: Sister Act
description:
**A Disco Diva, a Choir in Crisis, and a Whole Lot of Soul!**

***‚ÄúOne of the season‚Äôs happiest surprises.‚Äù* ‚ÄîElisabeth Vincentelli for New York Post**

***Sister Act* is the high-energy musical comedy based on the beloved 1992 film. Featuring an electrifying Alan Menken score infused with disco and gospel beats, this feel-good show is a celebration of music, sisterhood, and second chances.**

**When disco diva Deloris Van Cartier witnesses a crime, she‚Äôs forced into hiding‚Äîin a convent! Disguised as a nun, she transforms the struggling choir with her powerhouse voice, helping them find their sound while discovering her own. Nominated for five Tony Awards, *Sister Act* is a joyful, soul-stirring spectacle that proves music‚Äîand a little mischief‚Äîcan work miracles!**

description:

Welcome to **Live Music - The Ukulele Ramblers - Open Uke Jam!** Join us for a fun-filled evening of live music and ukulele jamming at Barrel Proof Lounge. title: Terrapin Roadshow at Monte Rio Amphitheater
description:
**Grahame Lesh** and the **Lesh Family** are proud to announce the return of the **Terrapin Roadshow** in 2026. More than a concert series, the Roadshow carries forward the spirit, sound, and sense of belonging that defined **Terrapin Crossroads**, creating a traveling home for this music and the community that has always followed it. Tickets are on sale now at terrapincrossroads.net.

The team has carefully selected some of the most intimate, magical, and majestic outdoor amphitheaters on the West Coast and beyond. From Northern California to Oregon‚Äôs Rogue Valley and the Western Slope of Colorado, the Terrapin Roadshow will visit a collection of extraordinary venues, including **Monte Rio Amphitheater** in **Monte Rio, CA** (**May 30‚Äì31**); **Forest Meadows Amphitheatre** in **San Rafael, CA** (**July 24‚Äì26);** **Marjorie Holzgang Concert Bowl** in **Grants Pass, OR** (**August 1‚Äì2**); **Truckee Amphitheater** in **Truckee, CA** (**August 15‚Äì16**); and **Two Rivers Park** in **Glenwood Springs, CO** (**August 22‚Äì23)**.

‚ÄúLast year‚Äôs Terrapin Roadshows felt like pure magic,‚Äù said **Grahame Lesh,** event co-producer and son of Grateful Dead bassist Phil Lesh. ‚ÄúEvery show was filled with great music and beautiful energy that reminded us how strong this community still is. It‚Äôs a powerful way to honor the legacy of the Grateful Dead while watching that spirit continue to grow and evolve. We‚Äôre so excited to bring those vibes back on the road and gather with Terrapin Nation again in 2026.‚Äù

For more information on the event, parking, lineup, and tickets, please visit terrapincrossroads.net

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Miles Davis at 100: A Centennial Celebration
description:
This program celebrates the many facets of the genius of Miles Davis as a musical, fashion, art and cultural icon. Join trumpeter Konstantins Jemeljanovs Quintet with special guest saxophonist, Tom Scott, as they explore the vivid career of Miles Davis.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Jovino Santos Neto
description:
Brazilian pianist and composer Jovino Santos Neto teams up with Scott Thompson and drummer David Flores to present his Brazilian music in a piano trio format. The compositions by Jovino, Hermeto Pascoal, and Marcos Valle will serve as points of departure for inspired musical conversations among the three extraordinary players. The music will range from the lyrical to the deep grooves this trio can generate.  Jovino‚Äôs personal style is a creative blend of energetic harmonies, telepathic improvisation, lyrical melodies and great ensemble playing, always inspired and informed by the colorful richness of Brazilian music. His compositions include samba, choro, bai√£o, xote, forr√≥, marcha and many more styles, rooted in centuries-old musical tradition while pointing to new and adventurous harmonic languages.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Petaluma River Full Moon Paddle
description:
Come play on the river at night.

Join The Floathouse for a magical evening paddle on the Petaluma River‚ÄîPetaluma‚Äôs Longest Park‚Äîtimed to catch the full moon rising over the wetlands just south of downtown. As twilight fades, we‚Äôll head out together in Hobie pedal kayaks for a relaxed, guided glide that turns nighttime into playtime.

These pedal-powered kayaks make the journey smooth and easy, even if there‚Äôs a breeze or moving tide. We‚Äôll cruise about a mile and a half downriver to the perfect moonrise vantage point, where calm water, wide skies, and glowing reflections set the scene.

This is a social, feel-good outdoor experience designed for anyone looking for something a little different to do after dark‚Äîpart nature, part adventure, part pure vibe.

**$60 per person includes everything:** ‚Ä¢ Hobie pedal kayak ‚Ä¢ PFD and safety lights ‚Ä¢ Experienced local guide ‚Ä¢ A memorable, moonlit river experience

‚ú® Easy. Playful. Peaceful. Spend your evening under the full moon‚Äîon the water.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Safari West Presents! Symbiiotica
description:
Conservation Dinner Series: Taye Bright of  Symbiiotica joins us in the elephant room after dinner to give a talk about fungi. The conservation dinner series is complimentary to all dinner guests. If you want to attend this presentation, please call our reservations team at \(707\) 566-3667 or \(800\) 616-2695 and they can book it for you. Dinner starts at 7:00 PM.    About the Speaker: Taye Bright is an applied mycologist, ecological regeneration practitioner, educator, artist, medicine-maker and mythopoetic dreamer orienting her life's work around fungi, fire/forest ecology, marine biology, symbioses and how to be in reciprocal, inter-species participation with our respective ecologies. Taye holds a degree in Biology, has certifications in Permaculture Design and Ecosystem Restoration Design, and is a certified California Naturalist. She teaches mycology-focused classes and guides fungal ecology walks around Northern/Central California with the intention of providing accessible and embodied scientific education outside of conventional academia. She is the owner and founder of  Symbiiotica , a small business offering mycological services, art, medicine and education as well as a co-owner of  Moon Fruit Mushroom Farm , an outdoor, log-based mycoforestry operation. She also works as a post-fire restoration and mycoremediation researcher for  CoRenewal and is in her 4th year as secretary for  Bay Area Applied Mycology . Outside of her scientific work, you can find her in the garden talking with birds, painting with mushroom ink, surfing, studying Norse mythology, cooking up delicious wild foods and reading poetry by the fire.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Aging with Grace: A Yoga Retreat for Adults 50 plus
description:
Aging with Grace: A Yoga Retreat for Adults 50 plus - Step into a joyful weekend of movement, relaxation, and renewal, thoughtfully designed for adults 50 and anyone who like this idea!

Book now and get $100.00 off listed prices. Offer valid until Feb 27, 2026

https://yourhealthandjoy.com/retreatmay2026/

$895.00 ‚Äì For 1 Guest in a Private Room \(Shared Cottage\)

We welcome back Guest Teacher Patricia Becker, beloved for her uplifting yoga and wellness teachings, to host a retreat that will rejuvenate your body, calm your mind, and rekindle your natural vitality.

This retreat tends tends to fill quickly‚Äîsecure your spot today!

Step into a joyful weekend of movement, relaxation, and renewal, thoughtfully designed for adults 50 and better.

As the seasons shift and nature begins to blossom, this retreat invites you to do the same‚Äîreconnect with your strength, flexibility, and inner glow.

With a nourishing blend of yoga, breathwork, meditation, and meaningful connection, you‚Äôll explore ways to move with greater ease, feel content, and age with grace. Whether you‚Äôre seeking more energy, deeper calm, or simply a pause from routine, this weekend offers the space to replenish, reset, and return home to yourself.

You‚Äôll stretch, strengthen, and smile your way through sessions supporting joint health, posture, spinal alignment, hip mobility, deeper breathing, and overall vitality‚Äîno pretzel poses required!

Playful curiosity and gentle guidance will help you tap into your body‚Äôs wisdom and celebrate what‚Äôs possible at every age.

What to Expect:

Uplifting yoga to build strength, balance, and mobility

Breathwork and meditation to calm your mind and restore energy

Time in nature to reflect, rest, and restore

Delicious vegetarian meals lovingly prepared

Connection with like-hearted people in a warm and welcoming space

Plenty of time to laugh, lounge, and be fully yourself

Hear what Guests have to say!

‚ÄúI loved the invigorating Aging With Grace Retreat at beautiful Ratna Ling ‚Äî which I attended with a few fellow Yoginis. I‚Äôm planning to return for more of Patricia‚Äôs gentle but powerful yoga, uplifting commentary, and lovely yoga community.‚Äù ‚Äî Desiree Petray

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a senior but I wanted gentle yoga and a relaxing weekend with time for introspection. I learned so much about my body and breath, and met amazing new friends. Patricia is knowledgeable, kind, and made the experience fun.‚Äù ‚Äî Ruby Williams

‚ÄúMy sister and I adored Patricia‚Äôs yoga retreat. The minute you arrive you know it will be special. Patricia creates a sense of community and offers just the right amount of stretching and strengthening. You feel graceful‚Äîlike you‚Äôve been enveloped by unconditional love.‚Äù ‚Äî Ann Protter

title: Terrapin Roadshow at Monte Rio Amphitheater
description:
**Grahame Lesh** and the **Lesh Family** are proud to announce the return of the **Terrapin Roadshow** in 2026. More than a concert series, the Roadshow carries forward the spirit, sound, and sense of belonging that defined **Terrapin Crossroads**, creating a traveling home for this music and the community that has always followed it. Tickets are on sale now at terrapincrossroads.net.

The team has carefully selected some of the most intimate, magical, and majestic outdoor amphitheaters on the West Coast and beyond. From Northern California to Oregon‚Äôs Rogue Valley and the Western Slope of Colorado, the Terrapin Roadshow will visit a collection of extraordinary venues, including **Monte Rio Amphitheater** in **Monte Rio, CA** (**May 30‚Äì31**); **Forest Meadows Amphitheatre** in **San Rafael, CA** (**July 24‚Äì26);** **Marjorie Holzgang Concert Bowl** in **Grants Pass, OR** (**August 1‚Äì2**); **Truckee Amphitheater** in **Truckee, CA** (**August 15‚Äì16**); and **Two Rivers Park** in **Glenwood Springs, CO** (**August 22‚Äì23)**.

‚ÄúLast year‚Äôs Terrapin Roadshows felt like pure magic,‚Äù said **Grahame Lesh,** event co-producer and son of Grateful Dead bassist Phil Lesh. ‚ÄúEvery show was filled with great music and beautiful energy that reminded us how strong this community still is. It‚Äôs a powerful way to honor the legacy of the Grateful Dead while watching that spirit continue to grow and evolve. We‚Äôre so excited to bring those vibes back on the road and gather with Terrapin Nation again in 2026.‚Äù

For more information on the event, parking, lineup, and tickets, please visit terrapincrossroads.net

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Santa Rosa Symphony - Road to 100, Year 3
description:
Road to 100, The Complete Beethoven Symphonies, Year 3 Sunday, May 31, 2026 at 3:00 pm Weill Hall, Green Music Center Francesco Lecce-Chong, conductor LUDWIG VAN BEETHOVEN: Symphony No. 4 in B-flat major, Opus 60 LUDWIG VAN BEETHOVEN: Symphony No. 6 in F major, Pastorale, Opus 68 In year three of the Road to 100: The Complete Beethoven Symphonies, SRS performs two of Beethoven's great works. Like a breath of fresh air, Symphony No. 4 is a luminous and graceful work, radiating noble simplicity. Symphony No. 6 journeys through idyllic landscapes, capturing humanity's profound connection to nature, and culminating in an uplifting hymn of gratitude. Performed with the orchestra in unique configurations reflecting how the symphonies, in Beethoven's time, may have been played. Be a part of the journey to our centennial celebration in the 2027-2028 season! Programs, dates, artists, and prices are subject to change without notice. Tickets are subject to availability.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Mobility Class with Efren
description:
This Movement-Fusion class is designed to build foundational mobility, deep flexibility, and graceful flow. It is a unique practice focused on systematically opening the body, enhancing your ability to move with ease, and creating more internal space.

You will leave feeling stronger, lighter, and more profoundly connected to your body‚Äôs potential. This class is perfect for athletes, dancers, and anyone looking to significantly improve their overall quality of movement and physical comfort.

About Efren

A health-fitness educator and mentor with over 15 years of experience leading group exercise classes, including aerobics, stretching, strength¬†training, Zumba, and dance workouts. AFAA, NASM, and trained as a Myofascial Release and¬†Precision¬†NMT‚ÄîTMJ Myofascial Practitioner.

Today, I integrate¬†a holistic approach to movement, blending the principles of mind-body connection.

What to bring: yoga mat, towel and yoga block as well or anything you need to support your practice. We usually do class barefoot.¬†

Date & Time: EVERY FIRST¬†SUNDAY IN THE MONTH 10 am \(see our schedule for availability\)

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Brainstormer Trivia with Rick Tosh
description:
So, Trivia-Mongers,¬†you think you're smart? Here's your chance to prove it. Join Quizmaster, Rick Tosh for "Brainstormer Trivia". Six rounds of compelling trivia that boggles the mind and stirs the soul! An entertaining evening of fun, and ephemera in a friendly team trivia competition. Pit your wits against friends and other intelligent life. Show off your astounding knowledge of pop culture, movies, music, sports, science, literature, famous faces, and more. Order delicious food and drinks while you play! Win HopMonk Gift Cards, fabulous prizes and bragging rights. Prizes for 1st, 2nd, and Average Team Score...It's FREE to play! Enjoy food and drink specials are available for purchase during the quiz! Free to Play!!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

Date & Time: Mondays @ 7PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

description:
Discover your family story at our Family Search Center You will find our center in the Lakeport building in the room next to the nursery. Local volunteers can help jumpstart your family history journey. Our center is staffed on Tuesdays from 1pm - 4pm, reach us in person or by phone \(707\) 280-9545 during those hours. All services provided in centers are free. You‚Äôll enjoy: Personalized help Center guests can receive personal help from volunteers in one of more than 5,400 centers worldwide. Access to technology Centers offer complimentary access to computers, internet, and subscription family history websites. Available resources vary by location. Access to exclusive records Visitors to FamilySearch Centers get special access to images of historical records that are only available in centers. Websites available at all locations: Ancestry, My Heritage, Family Search, Find My Past, American Ancestors, Geneanet https://www.family search.org Explore videos about family history and temples at collection/temple-and-family-history-messages-from-leaders?lang=eng

title: Beginner Salsa - Tuesdays
description:
Ready to dance? Join our beginner salsa class where no experience or partner is needed. Just comfortable shoes and desire to have fun!

Great for first timers!

No dance experience required

Non-marking shoes soles

No partner necessary

Our relaxed environment is perfect for learning salsa basics, as we make it fun and enjoyable. In this class you will learn basic directional steps, proper frame for partner-work and simple turn patterns. We organize our curriculum so that the movements are easy to remember. Join us to learn the fundamentals! No experience is necessary and no partner is required. Drop-in fee is $20.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 5:30PM ‚Äì 6:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Bachata with ALEX
description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Live Music Happy Hour - The Ukulele Ramblers - Open Uke Jam!
description:
Downtown Santa Rosa 'Golden Hour' 4-7p| Live music 5-7 p | $6 beers & $2 off wine |Tuesday-Saturday!

For people who like to party...but want to be home at a reasonable hour...Welcome to **Live Music - The Ukulele Ramblers - Open Uke Jam!** Join us for a fun-filled evening of live music and ukulele jamming at Barrel Proof Lounge. Bring your ukulele and strum along with The Ukulele Ramblers, a talented group of musicians who will be performing a mix of classic tunes and original songs. Whether you're a seasoned ukulele player or a beginner looking to learn, this event is perfect for all music lovers. So mark your calendars and get ready to enjoy a night of great music and good vibes. See you there!

Open Uke jam hosted by your friendly neighborhood Ukulele collective.

Bring your singing voice and your Uke if you've got one, and enjoy the comfortable, welcoming space at Barrel Proof Lounge! 21+ Happy Hour Pricing 4-6pm All beers - $6 + $2 off wine. Live Music 5-7pm 2 drink minimum, please

**www.UkuleleRamblers.net** Check out¬†**www.BarrelProofLounge.com**¬†for all sorts of good times ahead!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Lawyers in the Library
description:
Local volunteer attorneys offer free legal information and referral for general law matters. These lawyer consultations will last up to 20 minutes. Sign-ups are first come, first served in person and begin at 4:30 pm. \(30 minutes before the program begins\) --- The attorneys are volunteers and provide only legal information. They do not provide specific legal advice and should not be considered as personal lawyers for any reason. You will be required to sign a waiver before speaking to an attorney that states that no attorney-client relationship is being created with this free service. No language translation services or interpreters are offered or provided by library staff. Participants must bring their own interpreter if one is needed. Participants may also bring support persons, family members or other affiliated persons to meet with the attorney together. For deaf and hard of hearing participants, the Sonoma County Bar Association will make arrangements for ASL interpretation with at least two days' advance notice. Please contact Reception@SonomaCountyBar.org or \(707\) 542-1190 ext.100 for assistance. The program is a partnership between the Sonoma County Library, the Sonoma County Law Library, and the Sonoma County Bar Association and is staffed by volunteer attorneys. Learn more about the Lawyers in the Library program here.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Library Commission Budget Adoption & Regular Meeting
description:
The Rohnert Park - Cotati Library hosts library commission meetings in the Armando Flores Room. The Sonoma County Library Commission is an 11-person body responsible for governing the library. Commissioners are appointed by the cities in Sonoma County and the county Board of Supervisors. The commission establishes policy; sets goals and objectives; hires and evaluates the director; establishes and monitors the annual budget; and exercises such other powers, consistent with the law to foster the effective use and management of the library. The commission generally meets monthly, with additional special meetings as needed. Meetings are open to the public and recordings are accessible online through

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Date & Time:¬†Thursdays @7:30PM ‚Äì 8:30PM

Address:¬†4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

***Sister Act* is the high-energy musical comedy based on the beloved 1992 film. Featuring an electrifying Alan Menken score infused with disco and gospel beats, this feel-good show is a celebration of music, sisterhood, and second chances.**

**When disco diva Deloris Van Cartier witnesses a crime, she‚Äôs forced into hiding‚Äîin a convent! Nominated for five Tony Awards, *Sister Act* is a joyful, soul-stirring spectacle that proves music‚Äîand a little mischief‚Äîcan work miracles!**

Proper frame for partner work:¬†Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns:¬†We‚Äôll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We‚Äôve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required:¬†Whether you‚Äôve never danced before or it‚Äôs been a while, you‚Äôre welcome here!

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles:¬†This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

Date & Time:

Thursdays @ 6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM Fridays @ 5:30PM ‚Äì 6:30PM Saturdays @ 9:00 AM ‚Äì 10:00 AM

Instructor: Lucie Ebnerova

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Art at the Source Open Studios - Applications Open!
description:

High St, Sebastopol Read our Program Application Guidelines Here Art at the Source is an Annual Spring Open Studio tour with deep roots and professional credibility, powered by Sebastopol Center for the Arts \(SebArts\) for over 30 years! We connect Sonoma County artists to thousands of collectors, art lovers, and supporters across the greater Bay Area and beyond. Artist keep 100% of sales from their art studios. title: Salsa Beginner Marin ‚Äì Saturday
description:
**Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?**¬†Join on on Saturday ‚Äì Salsa Beginner Marin

Are you a beginner who‚Äôs always wanted to learn salsa? Salsa classes are designed to help you build a strong foundation. In this class, you‚Äôll learn the fundamental footwork, practice the basic turns, and understand the essential body movement that will make you feel confident on the dance floor. This class is perfect for anyone ready to learn the techniques and foundational steps needed to start their salsa journey.

Salsa is fun, and we make learning it stress-free! Our relaxed, beginner-friendly class is the ideal starting point. You don‚Äôt need a partner, nor any dance experience!

In this class you will learn:

Basic directional steps that form the foundation of salsa.

Proper frame for comfortable and effective partner-work.

Simple, easy-to-remember turn patterns.

Get ready to learn the fundamentals and have a great time!

**Details:**

**No partner necessary**‚Äîrotations ensure everyone dances

Please wear¬†**non-marking shoes**¬†to protect the floor

Arrive 10 minutes early; warm up and settle in

title: Sister Act
description:
**A Disco Diva, a Choir in Crisis, and a Whole Lot of Soul!**

***‚ÄúOne of the season‚Äôs happiest surprises.‚Äù* ‚ÄîElisabeth Vincentelli for New York Post**

***Sister Act* is the high-energy musical comedy based on the beloved 1992 film. Featuring an electrifying Alan Menken score infused with disco and gospel beats, this feel-good show is a celebration of music, sisterhood, and second chances.**

**When disco diva Deloris Van Cartier witnesses a crime, she‚Äôs forced into hiding‚Äîin a convent! Disguised as a nun, she transforms the struggling choir with her powerhouse voice, helping them find their sound while discovering her own. Nominated for five Tony Awards, *Sister Act* is a joyful, soul-stirring spectacle that proves music‚Äîand a little mischief‚Äîcan work miracles!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 30 mins including intermission

title: Live Music - The Ukulele Ramblers - Open Uke Jam!
description:
Join us for a chill evening of live music and good vibes with The Ukulele Ramblers at our happy hour event!

Welcome to **Live Music - The Ukulele Ramblers - Open Uke Jam!** Join us for a fun-filled evening of live music and ukulele jamming at Barrel Proof Lounge. Bring your ukulele and strum along with The Ukulele Ramblers, a talented group of musicians who will be performing a mix of classic tunes and original songs. Whether you're a seasoned ukulele player or a beginner looking to learn, this event is perfect for all music lovers. So mark your calendars for Sundays and get ready to enjoy a night of great music and good vibes. See you there! Open Uke jam hosted by your friendly neighborhood Ukulele collective.

Bring your singing voice and your Uke if you've got one, and enjoy the comfortable, welcoming space at Barrel Proof Lounge!

21+

Live Music 3-6 pm

Free Popcorn!

***www.UkuleleRamblers.net***

Check out¬†***www.BarrelProofLounge.com***¬†for all sorts of good times ahead!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Saturday Live Music at Spicy Vines feat. Open Hearts Band
description:
Where unforgettable wines, live music, and good vibes come together.

Join us every Saturday from 3‚Äì6 PM at Spicy Vines for a tasting room experience like no other ‚Äî where top local musicians from across the Bay Area meet our award-winning small-lot wines. From Rock & Roll and Blues to Jazz, Bluegrass, and Americana, each weekend brings new sounds and new reasons to raise a glass.¬†

Open Hearts Band Open Hearts Band delivers home-grown folk rock with heartfelt lyrics, rich harmonies, and a soulful groove that sticks with you. Blending original songwriting with raw acoustic energy, their sound is equal parts nostalgic and refreshingly real.¬†

Details

No cover. Walk-ins are welcome, but this event tends to fill up quickly, so we recommend making a reservation. We are dog and family friendly!
